title: How to vote in the US midterms 2018: Alexa has the answer | Trusted Reviews
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Credit: Photo by Raúl Nájera on Unsplash

**Such is the current climate, even Amazon’s Alexa assistant is talking
politics. In an update rolling out today, Alexa-enabled devices are now
offering US citizens information from Ballotpedia on where and how they can
vote the midterm elections, which take place on November 6.**

In a blog post, Amazon explained how Alexa users will be able to consult her
on what time the polls are open, what’s on the ballot in their area, and who
is running for senate in their state.

Perhaps most helpfully, the assistant will help with some of the more
confusing elements of the voting process. For example, users will be able to
ask: “Alexa, what does it mean to vote yes (or no) for [state] [ballot
measure]”?

After folks have cast their ballot on the races in their states, Alexa will
provide live updates from the Associated Press on how their chosen candidates
are performing. So, it’ll be possible to ask questions like “Alexa, what’s my
election update?”, “Alexa, who is winning in [state]?”, and “Alexa, how is
[candidate] doing in the election?”

**Related:[Best Alexa Skills](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/alexa-
skills-amazon-echo-2946222)**

When all of the votes have been counted, users can ask Alexa what happened,
how many seats did their chosen party gain/lose and discover how a particular
candidate performed in his or her race.

In a [blog post](https://blog.aboutamazon.com/innovation/alexa-whats-my-
election-update), VP of Alexa Information Bill Barton wrote: “We believe voice
provides a unique, simple, and delightful way to learn about election
information, and we want to be as helpful as possible for customers when
they’re preparing to vote and to offer real-time updates on polls and election
results.”
